lines.text: The volcano will probably soon be forgotten. In my memory, it is not the volcano that remains but the neglected and oblivion in which those black people live.
There was something pathetic for us in the shooting of this picture and therefore it ended a little bit embarassing. Now, it has become a report on an inevitable catastrophe that did not take place.
It will always remains a mystery why there was no eruption. Never before in the history of vulcanology when signals of such magnitude measures and yet nothing happened.
